Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to explore feelings about work, indicating a sense of unappreciation and a lack of recognition for their efforts. They also want to maintain the momentum of their progress, focusing on consistency in their practices.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports practicing breathing exercises which have helped manage anxiety, especially during a recent meeting. They feel more in control and empowered but also express feelings of being unappreciated at work, which affects their motivation.
Therapeutic Interventions: The therapist suggests the patient take the initiative to communicate their contributions positively and offers support in drafting a message to their manager.
Next Steps: The patient is encouraged to set a goal to have a conversation with their manager about their contributions and to establish a weekly check-in for progress on their goals.
